questions.text: **P, Q, and R** can complete a job individually in **15, 30, and 120 days**, respectively. **P and Q** start working together, but after **5 days, Q leaves**. **R** joins the work **4 days before** it is completed. How many days does **P** work (approximately)?
questions.solution:
Let Total work = $$LCM(15, 30, 120) = 120x$$ 
Efficiency of $$P = 120x/15 = 8x$$ 
Efficiency of $$Q = 120x/30 = 4x$$ 
Efficiency of $$R = 120x/120 = x$$ 
Let total days P works after Q left be **T**. 
According to the question: 
$$(Efficiency of P + Q) \times 5 + (Efficiency of P) \times (T-4) + (Efficiency of P + R) \times 4 = 120x$$ 
Alternatively, as per the PDF solution: 
$$12x \times 5 + 8xT + x \times 4 = 120x$$ 
$$60x + 4x + 8xT = 120x$$ 
$$8xT = 56x \Rightarrow T = 7$$ 
Required total days for P = $$5 + 7 = 12\text{ days}$$. 
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: **Ashu and Som** can individually complete a certain work in **20 days and 30 days**, respectively. With the help of **Meenakshi**, all three of them complete the work in **4 days**. If **Meenakshi and Ashu** together can complete **1.3 times** the work in **x days**, find the value of **x**.
questions.solution:
Let total $$work = 60x$$ 
Ashu's efficiency = $$60x / 20 = 3x$$ 
Som's efficiency = $$60x / 30 = 2x$$ 
Efficiency of all three (Ashu + Som + Meenakshi) = $$60x / 4 = 15x$$ 
Meenakshi's efficiency = $$15x - (3x + 2x) = 10x$$ 
New work to be done = $$60x \times 1.3 = 78x$$ 
Time taken by Meenakshi and Ashu = $$78x / (10x + 3x) = 78x / 13x = 6\text{ days}$$ 
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: If the efficiency of **A** is reduced by **11.11%** and that of **B** is reduced by **40%**, the total amount of work done by A and B individually in a day becomes the **same**. If **A** can complete a job alone in **10 days**, then the time taken by **A and B** together to complete the same job when **A works at 1/3 efficiency** and **B works at 80% efficiency** is **y days**. Find the value of **82y**.
questions.solution:
Let A's initial efficiency = $$9x$$ and B's initial efficiency = $$5y$$ 
Reduction: $$11.11\% = 1/9$$ and $$40\% = 2/5$$ 
$$9x \times (8/9) \times 1 = 5y \times (3/5) \times 1$$ 
$$8x = 3y \Rightarrow x = 3p, y = 8p$$ 
A's Efficiency = $$9 \times 3p = 27p$$ 
B's Efficiency = $$5 \times 8p = 40p$$ 
Total work = $$27p \times 10 = 270p$$ 
Required time (y) = $$270p / (27p \times 1/3 + 40p \times 80\%)$$ 
$$y = 270 / (9 + 32) = 270 / 41$$ 
Value of $$82y = (270 / 41) \times 82 = 540$$ 
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **Ram and Sam** together can complete a work in **20/3 days** and **Ram and Kavi** together can complete the work in **6 days**. If the ratio of the efficiency of **Kavi to Sam is 6:5**, then how many days **Ram alone** complete the work?
questions.solution:
Let total work = $$60x$$ 
Efficiency of (Ram + Sam) = $$60x / (20/3) = 9x$$ 
Efficiency of (Ram + Kavi) = $$60x / 6 = 10x$$ 
Let Ram's efficiency be **R**. 
Sam's efficiency = $$9x - R$$ 
Kavi's efficiency = $$10x - R$$ 
Ratio Kavi:Sam = $$(10x - R) / (9x - R) = 6/5$$ 
$$50x - 5R = 54x - 6R \Rightarrow R = 4x$$ 
Time taken by Ram alone = $$60x / 4x = 15\text{ days}$$ 
**Hence option E is correct (None of these).**

questions.text: The efficiency of **P** is **11.11% less** than that of **Q**, and the efficiency of **R** is **half** that of **P**. The difference between the time taken by **Q and R** alone to complete the work is **10 days**. If **P** can finish **5/4** of the work with **x% efficiency** in **25 days**, find the value of **x**.
questions.solution:
Let Efficiency of $$Q = 9x$$ 
Efficiency of $$P = 9x \times (8/9) = 8x$$ 
Efficiency of $$R = 8x / 2 = 4x$$ 
Ratio of efficiencies P:Q:R = **8:9:4**. 
Ratio of time taken = $$1/8 : 1/9 : 1/4 = 9 : 8 : 18$$ 
Difference in time (R and Q) = $$18u - 8u = 10u$$ 
$$10u = 10 \Rightarrow u = 1$$ 
Time taken by P = **9 days**, Q = **8 days**, R = **18 days**. 
Total work = $$Efficiency \times Time = 8 \times 9 = 72\text{ units}$$ 
According to the condition: 
$$72 \times (5/4) = (8 \times x/100) \times 25$$ 
$$90 = 2x \Rightarrow x = 45$$ 
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **A and B** alone complete the work in **32 days and 12 days** respectively. They started the work and after **2 days, C joined** the work. If **A, B and C** together complete the **remaining work in 4 days**, then in how many days **C alone** complete **15/2 times** of the work?
questions.solution:
Let total work = $$96x$$ 
A's efficiency = $$96x/32 = 3x$$ 
B's efficiency = $$96x/12 = 8x$$ 
Work done by A and B in 2 days = $$(3x + 8x) \times 2 = 22x$$ 
Remaining work = $$96x - 22x = 74x$$ 
Efficiency of (A+B+C) = $$74x / 4 = 18.5x$$ 
C's efficiency = $$18.5x - (3x + 8x) = 7.5x$$ 
Time taken by C for 15/2 times work: 
$$T \times 7.5x = 96x \times 15/2$$ 
$$T \times 7.5 = 720 \Rightarrow T = 96\text{ days}$$ 
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: Ratio of the efficiency of **Sameer to Kiran is 4:5** and **Rohan** alone complete the work in **10 days**. In **(z-5) days** Sameer alone completes the work if **Sameer, Kiran and Rohan** together complete **half of the work in 2 days**, then find the value of **2z**.
questions.solution:
Time taken by (Sameer + Kiran + Rohan) to complete full work = $$2 \times 2 = 4\text{ days}$$ 
Rohan takes **10 days**. Let total work = $$60x$$ 
Efficiency (S+K+R) = $$60x / 4 = 15x$$ 
Efficiency of Rohan = $$60x / 10 = 6x$$ 
Efficiency of (Sameer + Kiran) = $$15x - 6x = 9x$$ 
Sameer's efficiency = $$9x \times (4/9) = 4x$$ 
Time taken by Sameer alone = $$60x / 4x = 15\text{ days}$$ 
Given: $$z - 5 = 15 \Rightarrow z = 20$$ 
Value of $$2z = 2 \times 20 = 40$$ 
**Hence option E is correct.**

questions.text: A number of **men** can complete the work in **4 days**. **8 men and 2 women** can complete the same work in **5 days**. Find the number of men who complete the work in 4 days if the **efficiency of a woman is double** of the efficiency of a man.
questions.solution:
Let efficiency of 1 man = $$4x$$ 
Efficiency of 1 woman = $$8x$$ 
8 men + 2 women efficiency = $$8(4x) + 2(8x) = 32x + 16x = 48x$$ 
Total work = $$48x \times 5 = 240x$$ 
Let 'A' be the number of men required for 4 days: 
$$A \times 4x \times 4 = 240x$$ 
$$16x A = 240x \Rightarrow A = 15$$ 
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **x men** complete the work in **60 days** and **x women** complete the same work in **90 days**. If **10 men and 40 women** together can complete the work in **2.5 days**, then find the value of **36x**.
questions.solution:
$$x \times M \times 60 = x \times W \times 90$$ 
$$60M = 90W \Rightarrow M/W = 3/2$$ 
Efficiency: $$M = 3p, W = 2p$$ 
Total Work = $$(10 \times 3p + 40 \times 2p) \times 2.5 = (30p + 80p) \times 2.5 = 275p$$ 
Also, Total Work = $$x \times 3p \times 60 = 180px$$ 
$$180px = 275p \Rightarrow x = 275/180 = 55/36$$ 
Value of $$36x = 36 \times (55/36) = 55$$ 
**Hence option E is correct.**

questions.text: A certain number of **men** can complete the work in **60 days**. They started the work together and after **20 days, 4 men left**, and the remaining men complete the work. If the total work completed in **100 days**, then in **(y) days 2.5 men** complete the same work, then find the value of **y**.
questions.solution:
Let the number of men be **x**. Efficiency of each man = **1 unit**. 
Total work = $$60x$$ 
Work done: $$20 \times x + (x-4) \times 80 = 60x$$ 
$$20x + 80x - 320 = 60x$$ 
$$40x = 320 \Rightarrow x = 8$$ 
Total work = $$60 \times 8 = 480$$ 
Time taken by 2.5 men (i.e., $$2.5 \times 8 = 20\text{ men}$$): 
$$20 \times y = 480 \Rightarrow y = 24\text{ days}$$ 
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: A certain number of **persons** can complete the work in **70 days**. They started the work together and after **30 days, 11 persons newly joined**, and the remaining work was completed in **20 days**. Find the number of persons who complete the work in 70 days.
questions.solution:
Let the number of persons be **x**. 
Total work = $$70x$$ 
Work done: $$30x + (x + 11) \times 20 = 70x$$ 
$$30x + 20x + 220 = 70x$$ 
$$20x = 220 \Rightarrow x = 11$$ 
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: **X** can finish a job in **30 days**. **Y and Z** working together can finish the same job in **36 days**. If the ratio of the efficiency of **Y to Z is 3:4**, then by what percentage is the efficiency of X more (or less) than that of Z?
questions.solution:
Let total work be **W**. 
X's rate ($$x$$) = $$W/30$$ 
$$(Y + Z)$$'s rate = $$W/36$$ 
Given $$Y/Z = 3/4 \Rightarrow Y = 0.75Z$$ 
$$0.75Z + Z = W/36 \Rightarrow 1.75Z = W/36 \Rightarrow Z = W / (36 \times 1.75) = W/63$$ 
Comparing rates: $$x/z = (W/30) / (W/63) = 63/30 = 2.1$$ 
$$x = 2.1z$$ 
Percentage difference = $$( (2.1z - z) / z ) \times 100\% = 110\%\text{ more}$$ 
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: **D** can complete a work in **24 days**, and **D and E** working together complete the work in **16 days**. If **E working alone** takes **48 days** to complete the work, by what percentage must **E's efficiency increase** so that he can finish the work in **40 days**?
questions.solution:
D's rate = $$W/24$$ 
(D + E)'s rate = $$W/16$$ 
E's original rate = $$W/16 - W/24 = W/48$$ 
E's desired rate for 40 days = $$W/40$$ 
Increase needed = $$W/40 - W/48 = W/240$$ 
Percentage Increase = $$( (W/240) / (W/48) ) \times 100 = 20\%$$ 
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: **A and B** can finish a work in **15 days and 30 days** respectively. They work together for **5 days**, and then **B is replaced by C**. **A and C** together finish the remaining work in **5 days**. If **C alone takes x days** to finish the work, by what percentage is the time taken by **A less** than that of **C**?
questions.solution:
A's rate = $$W/15$$, B's rate = $$W/30$$ 
Combined rate (A+B) = $$W/10$$. 
Work done in 5 days = $$5 \times (W/10) = W/2$$ 
Remaining work = $$W/2$$ 
Rate of (A+C) = $$(W/2) / 5 = W/10$$ 
C's rate = $$W/10 - W/15 = W/30$$ 
So, C takes **30 days** ($$x=30$$). 
A takes **15 days**. 
Difference = $$30 - 15 = 15$$. 
Percentage less = $$(15 / 30) \times 100 = 50\%$$ 
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: **Rina** can complete **80%** of a work in **16 days**. Her efficiency is **25% more** than that of **Tanu**. If **Rina, Tanu, and Sia** working together complete **80%** of the work in **8 days**, in how many days can **Sia alone** complete **70%** of the work?
questions.solution:
Rina takes $$16 / 0.8 = 20\text{ days}$$ for 100% work. 
Rina's rate = $$1.25 \times \text{Tanu's rate} \Rightarrow \text{Tanu takes } 20 \times 1.25 = 25\text{ days}$$. 
Combined rate (R, T, S) for 100% work: $$80\% \text{ in } 8 \text{ days} \Rightarrow 100\% \text{ in } 10 \text{ days}$$. 
Rate of Sia = $$1/10 - (1/20 + 1/25) = 1/10 - 9/100 = 1/100$$ 
Sia alone takes **100 days**. 
Time for 70% work = $$100 \times 0.7 = 70\text{ days}$$ 
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: **A+B** can complete a work in **12 days**, **B+C** in **20 days**, and **A+C** in **15 days**. Worker **A** starts the work and finishes **1/2** of it. Then **B and C** work on **alternate days** (starting with B) to complete the remaining work. In how many days is the work finished?
questions.solution:
$$A+B = 1/12$$, $$B+C = 1/20$$, $$A+C = 1/15$$ 
$$2(A+B+C) = 1/12 + 1/20 + 1/15 = 12/60 = 1/5 \Rightarrow A+B+C = 1/10$$ 
Individual rates: $$A = 1/10 - 1/20 = 1/20$$, $$B = 1/10 - 1/15 = 1/30$$, $$C = 1/10 - 1/12 = 1/60$$ 
Time for A to do 1/2 work = $$(1/2) / (1/20) = 10\text{ days}$$. 
Remaining 1/2 work by B and C on alternate days: 
Work in 2 days (B then C) = $$1/30 + 1/60 = 3/60 = 1/20$$ 
Cycles needed = $$(1/2) / (1/20) = 10\text{ cycles}$$. 
Time for B and C = $$10 \times 2 = 20\text{ days}$$. 
Total time = $$10 + 20 = 30\text{ days}$$. 
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: **A, B, and C** working together can complete a work in **10 days less** than the time taken by **A alone**, in **half** the time taken by **B alone**, and in **one-third** the time taken by **C alone**. Find the time taken by **A, B, and C** working together to complete the work.
questions.solution:
Let the combined time be **T**. 
Individual times: $$A = T + 10$$, $$B = 2T$$, $$C = 3T$$ 
Equation: $$1/A + 1/B + 1/C = 1/T$$ 
$$1/(T+10) + 1/(2T) + 1/(3T) = 1/T$$ 
$$1/(T+10) + 5/(6T) = 1/T$$ 
$$1/(T+10) = 1/T - 5/(6T) = 1/(6T)$$ 
$$T + 10 = 6T \Rightarrow 5T = 10 \Rightarrow T = 2\text{ days}$$ 
**Hence option A is correct.**

questions.text: Worker **A** can complete **1/5** of the work in **10 days**. Worker **B is 6 times** as efficient as A, and worker **C** can complete **90%** of the work in **15 days**. In how many days can **A, B, and C together** finish the entire work?

A company plans to complete a project in **40 days** by employing **15 workers**. However, after **25 days, only 3/8** of the work has been finished. How many **additional workers** must be hired so that the project is completed on schedule?
questions.solution:
Total planned work = $$15 \times 40 = 600\text{ worker-days}$$ 
Work done in 25 days = $$(3/8) \times 600 = 225\text{ worker-days}$$ 
Remaining work = $$600 - 225 = 375\text{ worker-days}$$ 
Time remaining = $$40 - 25 = 15\text{ days}$$ 
Workers needed = $$375 / 15 = 25\text{ workers}$$ 
Additional workers = $$25 - 15 = 10\text{ workers}$$ 
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: If **20 male writers**, writing **10 hours a day**, can write **1600 articles in 8 days**. If the efficiency of each **female writer is twice** of male writer, then **10 female writers** write **y articles in 4 days** working **15 hours a day**, find the value of **y**.
questions.solution:
Using formula: $$(M1 \times D1 \times H1 \times E1) / W1 = (M2 \times D2 \times H2 \times E2) / W2$$ 
$$(20 \times 8 \times 10 \times 1) / 1600 = (10 \times 4 \times 15 \times 2) / y$$ 
$$1600 / 1600 = 1200 / y \Rightarrow y = 1200$$ 
**Hence option B is correct.**
